website_summaries.verdict: An eye-catching and heavy-duty appliance that comes in particularly handy for those who work with heavy cans.
pros: Includes a knife sharpener and cord storage
cons: Although a "heavyweight" appliance, it's made of plastic, which disappointed some buyers

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: This can opener is exactly what I have been looking for. I needed a replacement for my 10+ year old can opener. After reading reviews, I settled on this one. I am pleased with my choice. It is not overly loud when it opens the cans. For most standard size cans I can leave the can and walk away while it does its thing. When I open an oversized can of sauce, I put my hand underneath just in case, but it even handles those cans well. For the price, this is a great little can opener.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Pinks

customer_reviews.title: Weak, flimsy, unbelievably inefficient
customer_reviews.text: I have to say - I’m shocked. This just arrived today. Was so excited to finally replace my old & difficult electric opener with a brand new Hamilton Beach one. I couldn’t wait to try it, so I plugged it in immediately after unpacking & grabbed a regular size can of pumpkin. Not only would it NOT latch, but it didn’t even make an effort to turn. It was unbelievable! I’m so upset by this. I’d be better off with a traditional handheld! I wand my money back.
customer_reviews.author: DartingTrout

customer_reviews.title: Chrome colored light weight plastic push down lever.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Hamilton Beach CanOpener that I’ve had for over 10. The only reason I replaced is because after years of use the white lever had become yellow from age, it still worked great. They sure did scrimp on this newer model. The push down handle is made of cheap plastic painted to look chrome. Pops off for easy cleaning. I’m keeping it but wish it was made like it was years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Top heavy when opening large cans
customer_reviews.text: The description of this being a heavyweight can opener is incorrect. My last can opener worked just fine for large cans. This can opener does not work very well for large cans such as 28 oz tomatoes. The first time I used it for a 28 oz can, it fell over and splashed tomato juice all over me and the counter! I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this can opener in March 2019, used it on a few cans per month, barely at all. It’s now November 2019 and this happened. The main gear that turns the wheel that turns the can shattered. Mind you, this is the most important component of the opener after the blade and magnet. It’s made of some kind of cheap white metal or thick plastic. It’s sad as the unit was excellent in every other way that we could tell but come on, only a few months and a few cans each month and it shatters? I’m trying to contact Hamilton Beach as it’s under warranty but I’m not holding my breath.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jackiw

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: This never really worked great, but it opened cans most of the time. It always ripped the paper from around the edge of the can and got stuck and caused it to stop. It always caused the contents to splash out at the finish of the process. Very irritating. After about 6 months it doesn't work at all. Just rips the paper and the blade won't come close to cutting the lid. Don't buy it. Will cause you endless irritation and mess!
customer_reviews.author: queenee44

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after about 1 month and we don't have to open that many cans! It ended up in the refuse bin. Maybe we just got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used to be best can opener, now total plastic crap
customer_reviews.text: This same model 10+ years ago was the best out there. Now they have replaced all the metal with plastic. Only the blade itself is metal, the rest is plastic with chrome paint. If you can find the original model 76380 - when they add the "Z" to the model name then it's the chepo
customer_reviews.author: JP Vic

customer_reviews.title: Good can opener
customer_reviews.text: Now that we are getting older we find it harder to use the hand held can openers we'd been using all our lives. So we opted for an electric one. I chose this one because I had bought one just like it for my grand daughters wedding. She told me she loved it and it worked very well. For me it took a while to get the cutter into the right place since there is nothing to guide it so sometimes that's a struggle for me. It does eat the paper off the can as I read on some other reviews. All in all once I get the cutter in the right place it opens the can with not trouble.
customer_reviews.author: TempestScout

customer_reviews.title: Don’t order this model.
customer_reviews.text: Totally useless. Unlike the exact model I’ve used for years, this new one and the one I returned last week have no power to open a can. The weak sounding motor just bogs down after cutting a small arc of the rim. Two in a row bad, so I ordered a Cuisinart with good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: kbuck

customer_reviews.title: Not heavyweight, not tall
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to open a can of Bush's Baked Beans, it barely fit under the sharp edge, and then the whole thing tipped over. Not a heavy enough base, and not tall enough for large cans. I am sure it's fine for baby cans. Of air. Head comes off for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanni Gould

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that the magnet to capture the lid ...
customer_reviews.text: Moved into a new house and left my Black and Decker Spacemaker under-the-counter can opener not realizing what it would cost tor replace it. So, bought this one because of the reviews, color and price. It works well and does exactly what it is supposed to do. I like the fact that the magnet to capture the lid after you open the can is able to be tucked away. Easy to clean and attractive in our kitchen. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy O.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: To be honest I bought this opener for 2 reasons...I needed a new one...and its red color matched in my kitchen. But while I don't use it a lot, I have to say I am happy with this opener...it works much better than the one I had before...the magnet actually sticks to the lids of the cans I'm opening, which was a problem with the one it replaced...and so far I have had no trouble getting it to "lock onto" the cans and begin the opening process...another issue I had with the old one...that one sometimes took multiple tries before it would grip the can I wanted to open.
customer_reviews.author: Bensalem Al

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Can Opener
customer_reviews.text: First of all, It is all plastic but a beautiful red color. However it couldn't open one can! The piece the pierces the can is just plastic so it didn't pierce any can I tried to open. Worthless but like I said before, I loved the color and that's really why I purchased it but had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Lurie

customer_reviews.title: The lid magnet broke off
customer_reviews.text: The opener is not weighted down so when I opened a large heavy can, it fell over and the magnet part broke off. I should have returned it then. Now, when I open a can, liquid in the can runs over the top of the lid and is gross. I make sure I wash each can before I open it up.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Works super well so far, but much lighter weight and more plastic parts than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a few days, but it works GREAT!!! I'm a little considered about the lightweight plastic (it's much lighter than my last one), and the fact that even the silver part seems to be mostly plastic (of course the blade and turning wheel are metal). I'm just used to my former heavier model, which also had all metal attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Jemima

customer_reviews.title: TUNA CAN SAVER!!!! Best INVESTMENT ever!!
customer_reviews.text: TUNA CAN SAVER!!!! This is the best INVESTMENT I ever made related to food products/gadgets!! As a college guy, I always struggled opening the tuna can regularly, then I found this! THIS LITERALLY OPENS the Tuna can in 5 seconds! after reading some reviews, I was afraid this would only work for all cans except tunas, but then I said let me try it and im INLOVE with this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes cannot get the blade to cut into the can and I have to try many many times before it goes. It ends up shedding the paper off my can. And EVERY time the can is done being cut it splatters juice all over the counter from the release of the magnet. Super annoying. Wether it's sauce, liquid, syrup, etc. never fails. All in all, the product works so far after one months use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than my old Black and decker
customer_reviews.text: Great can opener with classic style opening. We purchased one of the new can opener (a different brand) that cuts around the top, but it kept giving us trouble. Wouldn't cut completely, plus I like to squeeze the water off of a can of tuna when I open it... But you can't do that with those openers. So we bought this one, and I am happy we did! It cuts nice and smoothly, no issues. I love it. I'm sure it isn't as good as the can openers made in the 1960s but I'm satisfied that it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Leddy

customer_reviews.title: Old faithful
customer_reviews.text: I bought my original Hamilton Beach can opener about 10 years ago. It finally bit the dust while cleaning it (the magnet piece randomly snapped off while wiping it off, image my horror). I searched far and wide for quality replacement that want an arm and leg. I was surprised to stumbled on this a decade late. A quality product indeed. I hope to have many years with this new one. So far so good. Happy can opening!!
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Falls over easily
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and is intended to be baby sat while opening cans. It's a recent purchase and I had no problems opening 14 oz cans. Today I inserted a 16 0z can and stepped away. The can opener turned over at the end and spilled everything all over the counter top, cabinets and floor.
customer_reviews.author: SLA

customer_reviews.title: GOOD product!
customer_reviews.text: Love that once you start opening the can it is hands free, stops when cutting is complete. The lever that you push down to start the cut moves easily with no force needed. Yes it is a plastic lever but no force needed so I don't see it breaking in the future. Cuts quickly and easily. Best can opener I have ever used. Price is the same as the Amazon Basics model which I returned. It quit working after opening one can!
customer_reviews.author: S Voss

customer_reviews.title: Yup. It's an electric can opener.
customer_reviews.text: I like it because it works and it hasn't broken yet after four or five months. I don't like the fact it can't really hold more weight than a regular can of soup-- always topples forward with my beef stew cans so you gotta hold it. However, it does what you need it to at a good price!
customer_reviews.author: TooManyCats

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach 76380Z Classic Chrome Heavyweight Can Opener, Black
customer_reviews.text: my husband Bob bought this for me, I needed an electric can opener, since I can't use a hand held opener any longer. The listing for this said very strong, durable can opener, able to handle to open large cans..... Not true, I find this cheaply made, and when I put a large can of tomato puree on it the whole thing fell over. My husband threw the box and mailer away so fast that I can't send it back or I would. If it says heavy duty in the description I expect it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Super scratched and used!
customer_reviews.text: This deserves ZERO stars. I believe this item was used. It was so scratched and dusty when I took it out of the box which wasn’t in good condition either. So very disappointed. This is my first product I’ve ever received that was used. I can’t believe the seller would try to resell that. The pictures speak for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Vassilakis

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: My can opener (not made anymore) is wearing out and I've been trying to find good reviews on the current can openers for six months. Finally, saw this one on sale in a department stores and checked out the reviews on Amazon and went ahead and purchased it. For the most part, reviews were great. I wasn't totally convinced but have been using it several weeks with no problems. It certainly is sharper than my old one and very easy to use. I would recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: What can one say about a can opener? It opens cans. It doesn't hurt your wrist because it doesn't require you to exert any effort to open the cans. It even captures the lid of the can with a magnet. Yes, the removed lid will have sharp edges. That's been the way can openers have opened cans practically since the dawn of cans. But the can itself will be left with a smooth and safe inner edge. I'm content.
customer_reviews.author: MDG

customer_reviews.title: VERY happy with this can opener.  Easy to use.  Holds the can and lid after opening
customer_reviews.text: This is a great can opener. It opens even the tall family sized cans. It holds the lid after the can is open. It also cuts like the old can openers around the lid vs. inside the lid like the new openers (i hated that, could never drain cans that had water like tuna). Super happy. Easy to clean too. No problems with it and it's used surprisingly a lot. It is surprising too because at both Target and Walmart... there were only 3 electric can openers at Walmart and only 1 at Target. That tells me that people don't open cans anymore! LOL
customer_reviews.author: terster

customer_reviews.title: Very Finicky. Recommend Another Can Opener.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this right before I moved house in January. So far, so good! ***Update: After about 18 months of use, I have a different opinion about this can opener. First, it is very difficult to clean. Second, God forbid there is a tiny dent or imperfection in the can, because this will absolutely refuse to work. If there IS a dent on the top of the can and you try to open the bottom, this will also not work. I'm now having to buy an entirely different machine because this one doesn't work right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy this sooner?
customer_reviews.text: I have pets that eat canned food and I would struggle with my hand held opener. What a pain in the neck! Finally I gave in and got this electric one and I love it! I have owned it for some time now and have never experienced a problem. It opens cans hands free once you sink the blade in with perfect results every time. The magnet prevents the lid from falling in and helps you avoid any accidental cuts. It is very light weight and does not take up much room. If ever I needed another, I would not hesitate to purchase this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Bee

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: It’s so simple to use. I’m very satisfied with my purchase. My only complaint is how it was dropped off. They just slapped a label on the original packaging and sent it on its way. Wasn’t put in a box so it was pretty beat up and partially opened. It’s not something you want to see during a time like this. Disinfected immediately!
customer_reviews.author: solstice

customer_reviews.title: It works but it’s annoying
customer_reviews.text: This item does work, but it is very annoying. It is difficult to get the can to line up correctly. It takes up to 10 tries to get it line up to open. It often takes the paper off the can and getting it caught up in the gear. It’s great that the top is detachable, because you’ll need to take it off ever time you use it to clean the magnet. Once open it pushes it down submerging it in the contents of the can... I hope this thing lasts because it would be the only redeeming feature about it. I would look elsewhere...
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Broke after light use
customer_reviews.text: The magnet fell off with a lid, I didn't notice, now it doesn't keep lids out of the jar when they are opened. This broke after 2 months. The company won't send me a new replacement magnet, rather, they're charging me $11 to ship me a new can opener. That's what I call a ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: gk

customer_reviews.title: Great can opener at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I'm older, and starting to have problems with manual can openers. This one works really well, and I like that the assembly removes from the base for cleaning. There are a lot of plastic parts and it's fairly light weight, but seems sturdy and well made. It removes the lid rather than the ones that open to the can around the outside of the top, and I prefer that method.
customer_reviews.author: MagpieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A can opener that actually works
customer_reviews.text: The can opener that I had was one that opened "smoothly" without cutting open the can. It seemed like a good idea, but it never really worked right, then it finally just quit. I love this new one- it actually cuts the lid and holds the can and then spots. What a concept! It's a nice weight, looks good on the counter, well made and good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Broken After ONE Use
customer_reviews.text: The instructions said no need to support the can while it is opening, but I supported it anyway just to be cautious. The next can wouldn't open at all. This can opener is junk!
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my mother whose wrists are getting weaker
customer_reviews.text: No one likes to see a parent lose independence because their body is failing them. This can opener fixed my mother's problem of not being able to open cans anymore with a traditional can opener. Such a small change can make a big difference in someone's self-perception of their abilities. I highly encourage this for those who don't like or aren't able to open cans anymore; it's worth the money, I promise. My mother's happiness, at least, was 100% worth it no matter how much money I spent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great can opener!
customer_reviews.text: I had this model's predecessor for many years and loved it even after the magnet broke off. Finally decided to treat myself to a new one and was pleased to see the design has only improved. I love it. Very easy to use & will accommodate tall cans.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!! BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I have purchased 2 can openers since we moved 16 months ago. I had a Black and Decker spacemaker under-the-counter can opener for years at our previous home and it worked like a charm. The two we purchased here have been JUNK! I took a chance on the Hamilton Beach and when I got it, I put a can on it to open and barely even pressed down on the handle, it caught on, and very smoothly opened the can! Don't hesitate! Add to your cart and BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.author: NayNay33

customer_reviews.title: Had another one
customer_reviews.text: I had one exactly like this one for many years. So when the latch broke.. I looked for the same one because this one lasted for a very long time and the motor went fast and was great . This new one is just the same . The only thing is I can hear the motor slowing down midway through opening cans . Come on !!! I was disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Noneya

customer_reviews.title: Motor blew after after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Only had this opener for a little over 6months and the motor already blew on it with moderate use. Never really liked the cut on it as it would make the top fall in and was extremely rough and jagged as it cut but it served its purpose. Also constantly tipped over while in use had to keep a strong grip on it. It is extremely ridiculous that this would break after 6months it’s not even used daily. I will never buy this brand again, this is unacceptable! Literally stopped working trying to open a tiny Goya can🤦🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Jen Licata

customer_reviews.title: What have I been doing my whole life
customer_reviews.text: I have tendinitis from bartending which makes opening cans painful. I’m also a caregiver for a mentally disabled couple who both have unsteady hands and have cut themselves before while opening cans. This has changed our lives! It’s so easy to use, straight forward and it holds the can while it opens it, so you can secure the can with one motion and walk away while it opens it ☺️
customer_reviews.author: Haleh Squires

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and effective!
customer_reviews.text: This can opener is great on so many levels. First it is TALL. Long or big cans mount w no issues. It’s also quiet. No more sounding like a weed whacker in my kitchen!! The removal of blade is so simple. Pops off and back on with magnetic clutches. Pierces cans the first time. No more bumbling. Added bonus. It’s attractive and sleek. Beautiful color of red. Verrrrry best opener I’ve owned in 35 years
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J.

customer_reviews.title: Useless Can Opener It opened two cans
customer_reviews.text: Useless Can Opener It opened two cans. The next time I tried to use it, It wouldn't latch onto to the can or open it. it's a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: J. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Solid can opener
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to replace a similar make/ model that lasted us over 10 yeaars. It is tall enough to open most cans and is easy to use. Hard to find anything these days that does not contain some plastic, but if used with care, it should last you a long time. Our old one fell off the counter and the top part that you push down broke off, so no fault of the unit...
customer_reviews.author: Larry K

customer_reviews.title: Good quality worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It's very high quality for being $14 it work just as if I spent $30 on a can opener it is very heavy duty at least the way I feel like cut perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Franscene221

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY HANDS
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled with every. single. can. opener. in my life. I’ve spent ludicrous amounts of money on conventional handheld can openers that have never worked for long and always caused me pain. I think I always assumed an electric can opener like this one would cost too much to invest in. Boy am I glad that I was so wrong. This little guy was 300% worth the effort, frustration, and pain it has saved me.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Not as shown in picture.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even get a chance to use it, immediately upon opening I realized that it is not like the picture. It was missing the bottle opener that is suppose to be on the back of the can opener. I will have to return.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaO.

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen purchase
customer_reviews.text: If you have sprained your dominant wrist and you're tired of fighting with the traditional can openers then this is the product for you. The can opener looks exactly as the picture shows. You just press the magnet onto the can and it starts cutting. Durable. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal frazier

customer_reviews.title: I am sold on this can opener!
customer_reviews.text: After not having an electric can opener for probably 15-20 years, I decided to buy one because of a little bit of aching in my right hand and I needed the ease and convenience of an electric opener. I chose this Hamilton Beach model because of its good reviews and I liked the looks of it. It fits in well on my kitchen cabinet, not too obvious or distracting and does a great job. I have not had any problems opening whatever size can I try out with it. The cut is clean and never jagged or dangerous. I really like it!!
customer_reviews.author: SWard

customer_reviews.title: Used... Rip-off!
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty mad right now. I paid for a brand new can opener & I can tell it has been opened by someone else and It just doesn't look right. Plus it wasn't even put in a mailing box & there was white tape sealing it closed! My husband & myself are elderly and are afraid to go to the post office to return it. So very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: ConCon

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Throw Away your money
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I buy, the first lasted 6 months, this one shut down in a month with little use. Changed location of electric outlet and still does not even turn on. I thought Hamilton Beach was a good brand, obviously has not been for a while. Products are made “disposable” in this age, but ONE month? No More Hamilton Beach products
customer_reviews.author: Connie DuBiel

customer_reviews.title: Works great except I have to hold it for heavier cans
customer_reviews.text: The older one I replaced with this was about the same size and was able to hold the larger size cans without me having to stand there and hold it. I don't have too many of those to open so it isn't a big deal but if someone did, I'd suggest to keep looking for a different opener that weighs more or is designed differently to hold up the larger cans. Otherwise I like it.
customer_reviews.author: WHC

customer_reviews.title: Best Cheap Can Opener I've Had
customer_reviews.text: I've been through a lot of can openers. Some work for a while and some never work. This one works better than any of them and is a little easier to use. I hope it holds up over time. It's easier to line the can up right to get it started and doesn't require a learning curve where you have to intimately know it to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: MrBigAxe

customer_reviews.title: Buy your last can opener....ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the same exact model we purchased twelve years ago for less than twenty bucks, both times. We are a large family and entertaining is foremost in this family. I can not imagine how many cans it opened in all those years, a great can opener indeed! I didn't have to look far to find the exact model to replace it with... I have owned many can opener in my seventh years on this earth. Take my advice and buy your last can opener! It's the Ninja of can openers!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M. Crowley

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent opener for the price. I’ve had it for a couple of months now and have had no issues opening anything. I also really like the fact that you can pull out the mechanism and thoroughly clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael N

customer_reviews.title: What an opening
customer_reviews.text: We were in bad need of a new electric can opener since our previous one tore up more of the can tops than opened them. It was a pleasure to pretty freely open cans once again. However, it is pretty critical where the actual can lip is placed to get a complete circle cut. Some cans can take two passes for an entire opening.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Mom is happy, however the quality is much less than their previous version.
customer_reviews.text: I have one we purchased years ago, and it is heavy and solid. This one is CHEAPLY made, lighter metal, and just overall poorer quality. If you are replacing, be prepared to be disappointed. As it is, I bought this for my mom, so it wasn't a replacement. I didn't tell her it was less quality than my "identical" one; and she seems pleased enough with this one. Still... I miss quality.
customer_reviews.author: K.A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Actually works
customer_reviews.text: I finally found a can opener that works! I’ve had a hard time finding a decent working can opener... my last standing one worked when it wanted to... then I tried a couple of those automatic type openers that leave a smooth edge, and those are all garbage too. Works first try. Only downside is when opening large/heavy cans the opener tends to tip over so you have to actually hold the can and opener upright. But that works for me!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Item was defective
customer_reviews.text: This opener was purchased as a discounted warehouse item, listed as used but like new. After it arrived I tried using it and it would not open a can. It appears the gear that operates to turn the can as it opens was defective. After several tries to get it to operate correctly without success, it was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Kriehn

customer_reviews.title: Magnet surprisingly holds the can and you get a nice smooth cut without sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 2 MONTH: so as good as this was, now went to use it and as soon as you plug it in, motor turns on and keeps going. would not be surprised if it dies soon. have to decrease to 1 star because of this. definitely not worth the money. out of the return window, so out of luck on that front. cannot recommend any longer. ***************************************************************************************************************************************************************** works well. Magnet surprisingly holds the can and you get a nice smooth cut without sharp edges. Does the job as advertised and works well so far.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: This can opener is awesome so far
customer_reviews.text: This can opener is awesome so far. The post office delivered it while I was in the middle of cooking. Perfect timing! I immediately opened it and put it to use. I was replacing my old electric can opener which was awful. The can would have to be aligned exactly right for the opener to work, and if misaligned at all, it would make a horrible grinding noise. Anyway, this new one is really quiet, and extremely easy to use. The old one went directly to the trash after using this just once.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: after I provided visual proof the original item had been rendered useless. Poor
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed item. Lid lifting arm was made of thin plastic and broke after being used a few times, but beyond Amazon's replacement window. Warranty handling was a hassle. Hamilton Beach agreed to replace but expected customer to pay inflated ( in my opinion) shipping costs. They finally agreed to replace waiving all costs, after I provided visual proof the original item had been rendered useless. Poor experience
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am really tired of crappy can openers
customer_reviews.text: I am really tired of crappy can openers, both manual and electric. This WAS the ELECTRIC can opener to own, Unfortunately, the CUTTIN HEAD is not replaceable. I mean, you can take it out and put it in the dishwasher, but you need to buy a whole new unit The electic motor may be fine, but... Then Hamilton Beach the company offered me 40% off any non-commercial appliance on their website, great! but when attempting to purchase they add SHIPPING, which is included in the prices on their website, making it a totally mucked up deal. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it as she could never open cans with a manual opener. It took a few tries to get the hang of using but then it's fine to use. Have opened big and small cans, not sure on exact sizes, but seems to cut just fine. Once or twice has cut the paper label and that got a bit messy in the cutting mechanism. Other than that it's been great!
customer_reviews.author: JohnyR

customer_reviews.title: It works well!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this electric can opener! It is so easy to use and so efficient! Well worth the money, every penny! It has a knife sharpener in the back that I never use, added bonus! It opens cans so easily and looks sleek on the counter! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Vyna

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS AFTER OUR HAND TURNED STRIPPED AND NEEDED A QUICK REPLACEMENT. WORKS GREAT BUT HANDLE IS PLASTIC AS OTHERS SAID. JUST USE WITH GENTLE CARE. DO NOT MANHANDLE AND IT SHOULD GIVE YOU YOUR MONEYS WORTH. iM THINKING ABOUT BUYING ANOTHER FOR A GIFT . THE PRICE IS VERY GOOD . SHALL SEE HOW IT HOLDS UP OVER TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Cozy Mystery Reader

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a can opener that stops cutting automatically after removing the lids of cans and has a clean cut. I was not able to make my previous can opener stop running after opening a can and I thought I would end up either hurting myself or I would spill the contents of the cans since it was still running and spinning the can while I was trying to lift up the stuck lever. This can opener functions perfectly, although it is top heavy and needs to be held if there is a tall/large size can being opened. I haven't and might never use the bottle opener and knife sharpener, so I cannot review their quality.
customer_reviews.author: ElegantFrost

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is a classic look and style!!
customer_reviews.text: Hamilton Beach 76380Z Classic Chrome Heavyweight Can Opener, Black This is a classic but useful can opener!! This has a removable cutting unit which allows you to freely clean the top of the can opener where all the junk goes and never gets clean with non removable ones! The convenient cost storage and knife sharpener are an added bonus. Especially for the price!! The extra tall design allows you to freely open bigger cans with complete ease!!! This is not too loud when being used and works extremely well I recommend this to anyone who is looking for a new one or giving one as a gift!!
customer_reviews.author: Here for youTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Opens Cans Each And Every Time.
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had any problems opening cans. Works well enough if you at first take the time to understand how it operates. The can has to be positioned in a certain way to work. There is a little wiggle room and that makes it fairly easy every time. Speed is good enough. Magnet keeps the lid secured until you pull it off for disposal. Would I buy it again? Yes. Four Stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ !!
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar Vogtmann

customer_reviews.title: I was in love till it fell apart,JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2018. I am so sorry I wasted this much money on a piece of junk and am terribly disappointed in Hamilton Beach for thinking this was worth the price. I don't open that many cans at all. A pin came out of the cutting part and now it's not usable. Waste of money!.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Lou

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Stronger magnet than previous ones I've had and will cut thru dents, though some bad dents does slow it down or strain it some. Works great on small & medium cans; won't be trying large cans until cooler weather and preparing things like chili in a big pots. Easier than Tupperware manual opener and great for arthritis suffers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy!
customer_reviews.text: I've resisted the use of an electric can opener for years trying to limit unnecessary use of electricity as part of my contribution to helping the environment, but now I have carpel tunnel in both wrists and a sister living with me who only has use of one arm due to cancer damage. We are thrilled with how easily it opens cans with little effort on our part. It's also very attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon K

customer_reviews.title: Why was I using a manual??
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought this a long time ago! My only issue is that the magnet needs to be lifted up and the can positioned just right before turning on. I've used on where you just put the can up to the blade and push the button down. This one isn't like that, but it's still a good product for the value.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: I was excited when I saw how cheap this was, but then I got it I learned why. The Chrome covered parts are not metal, they are plastic or some other light, flimsy material. It really does work fine, the magnet is powerful, but it is a little weird trying to get the can to start cutting though I have gotten it to do the job each time. But sometimes it chews up the paper at first instead of opening the can, so you have to resituate it. Ultimately I worry the plastic parts won't make this long lasting, but it looks nice and has done the job so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty, tips over when opening cans
customer_reviews.text: The can opener does not stand up when trying to open number 2 cans. Additionally, it took several attempts for the blade to catch on to the can to open it. I'm returning the item. Heavy duty it is not
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Guerrini

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it can open tall cans but..
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace an old warnout kitchen aide one that opened large and heavy cans well. Figured since I was replacing might as well find a red one. Nice looking cuts well but ripples over if you don't hold it up and the can on at the same time,makes a heck of a mess when can contents fly all over.
customer_reviews.author: louanne leppert

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen appliance
customer_reviews.text: This is a great heavy duty can opener that I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Our can opener broke less than a week before Thanksgiving. Of all times, right?! I have Prime and wound up getting it in one day instead of two. Yay! It's not very loud, smooth cut and blends in nicely when stored away. A great addition every kitchen needs :)
customer_reviews.author: Mina_Chan_301

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my cheap can opener was just tearing up the paper on the cans and making a mess. Well, the first time I used this, it took the paper completely off the can. However, after that it was fine and didn’t do it again. Just so you know, the components are NOT metal. Not a bad cheaper can opener.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: When I plugged it in for the 1st time it just ran non stop and I couldn't get it to quit until I unplugged it. I returned it for a refund and decided to just stick to the old hand crank model. *lol* ;-p
customer_reviews.author: Amar Rhom

customer_reviews.title: So much yes
customer_reviews.text: Oh man, game changer. My dog eats wet food every day and it was a pain to wake up every morning and yank around the can opener. Now I just pop it onto this thing and it’s open. I know it sounds dumb, but it’s the little things like this product that make life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mb5431

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this can opener. It’s easy to put the can into, cuts well and quickly. But less than 5 months after starting to use it, it stopped working! The motor still runs, but the blade won’t punch into the can. Very disappointed. My last can opener lasted twenty years. I have a toaster that was made in the 1930s that still works and makes perfect toast! Why can’t companies make decent small appliances anymore?!
customer_reviews.author: T. Gage

customer_reviews.title: Great little oponer!!
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace my two year old Cuisinart opener which had began giving me problems months ago. Saw the many good reviews and ordered one and am happy I did. This little mighty might does a better job than the much more expensive Cuisinart at half the price!
customer_reviews.author: CRAWDAD

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a handsome can opener/knife sharpener, but it is not durable. The problem is the movable part that cases blade & magnet. It is made of a weak & flexible plastic. This plastic part, under its normal operation opening a can, (applying normal pressure to bring down blade to meet gripping wheel) flexes as much as a plastic fork that holds down a steak to be cut.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Deloire

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use / light weight
customer_reviews.text: Opener was lighter than I thought it would be and that made me adjust how i use the can opener a little. It's pretty quiet, opens the cans quickly and so far have had not issues with the opener at all.
customer_reviews.author: Duingtime

customer_reviews.title: Good product that is easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived within two days and was well packaged. It appears that the product had been used as it had some light scratches on it and the cord was not well wrapped. Pros: The product itself is well made and opens cans quickly and easily. I have opened tuna and larger canned goods, all with great success. The cutting blade and magnet are removable so they can be cleaned. This is a huge plus as we have some vegans in our household and I like to clean the opener well after opening tuna. Cons: Looked used The "chrome" is colored plastic, but it looks nice...
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A. HawkinsTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRODUCT AT A REASONABLE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: A compact device that easily fits in a kitchen. PROS: quickly opens small and large cans. After start, hands-free. Lid held by magnet. Cord folds into base but is not spring loaded. CONS: a bit hard to use until you get the knack of it. I found knife sharpener near base useless, and downgraded one star for that reason. Kitchen knives are expensive and require care. Keep an oil-stone handy!
customer_reviews.author: Worstcase

customer_reviews.title: I really like this can opener
customer_reviews.text: I really like this can opener. I have not had an electric can opener in over 30 years. Now with weaker hands due to hand surgeries and after reading Amazon reviews I decided to buy this opener and I'm glad I did. Works with ease and the quality is good. I am very pleased with my purchase. It also fits some taller cans. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Barrilleaux

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, compact
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to use. Grab hold of cans easily and removes lid completely. I am happy to say that I have not been driven to tears getting the opener to hold onto the can and no longer have to go over and over it to get it removed completely. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Warner

customer_reviews.title: Good but lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Nice can opener for the price. I was frantic when my 1970's Rival " Harvest Gold" model finally quit and I tried a few other brands , both of which cost more than this one, but this model seems to do the job. I will say...it's VERY lightweight and will tip forward easily. Also, it crimps the lids in an odd way but I wonder if they all do this because the other two new models I tried did the same thing. ( my old Rival just left the straight edge...but maybe this new technology is so you won't slice off your fingers).
customer_reviews.author: E. Constable

customer_reviews.title: tricky at first
customer_reviews.text: yes it was trickey at first after using half of all the other junk on the market but, when I got the hang of it, it then was a snap .OH ! yes I rempved the head and ceaned it thouroughly and replacaced it successfuly and then used it again .GOOD WOrK
customer_reviews.author: Randy A.

customer_reviews.title: love the opener it is a shame it doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: every thing about this can opener was what I wanted. a detachable mechanism so I could clean it in the dish washer. the one I received - the gear would not turn and the motor sounded stuck. was not packaged well, Did not have the option for a replacement, so I have to return, but will be ordering another.
customer_reviews.author: Reese L

customer_reviews.title: NOT  A CAN OPENER - DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: It isn't a can opener if it won't open a can. Whatever this used to be, it isn't now. There's some basic design flaw that makes it unable to even puncture the lid. Returning. Looking for something made in America, because I guarantee this wasn't.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Mae

customer_reviews.title: This works really well.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife, who has issues with arthritis. It's easy to use and cuts a nice clean edge on the can. The one draw back is that it is not balanced. You need to hold your hand on top of the unit while opening a can, otherwise it will fall over. But that's not a huge issue for us.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Greenfield

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love that the little silver piece that holds the actual can opener pops out for easy cleaning
customer_reviews.author: browneyes1308

customer_reviews.title: Product doesnt work.
customer_reviews.text: The item is complicated and just did not work. My aim in purchasing this product was to make life easier not HARDER. It is such a disappointment. Even though I followed all the steps but to no avail. An attempt to contact supplier also was futile. So now I am stuck with a useless purchase. Please help.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: What a relief!
customer_reviews.text: Holds the can and you only need one finger to open the can, just press down, it does all the work for you! I used to get so pissed off on cans and openers, was so close to cut myself, almost threw cans against the walls... com'on I have like 5 different can openers at home and they all suck... OMG how much more can I ask from the can opener? - Just open that stupid can... it's not that hard. Tell you all: whether you have the same problem like me or any other, this thing opens fast and without acting like a jerk and that is what we need!
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Works as Presented
customer_reviews.text: This is a light weight can opener as I discovered when I tried to open a large can of peaches. You must hold the can in your palm as it turns to open to keep the opener from tipping over. Aside from that problem it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, Simple, and it Works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this years ago for my mother, then one for my grandmother, then one for myself. It works smoothly! It cuts the sides (horizontal cut) directly below the top rather than the top (vertical cut) like many others do. It makes it easier to get things out of the can.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Z. Batey

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Classic Chrome Heavyweight Electric Automatic Can Opener with SureCut Patented Technology, Knife Sharpener, Cord Storage, Black (76380Z)
product_meta.description: Color:BlackRemovable, washable cutting unit. Surecut patented technology opens cans the first time, every time. Knife sharpener, automatic shutoff. Hamilton Beach Can Openers take some of the work out of meal preparation. And because life is complicated, these multi-tasking products are ready to take on cans, and even sharpen knives.
feature_bullets: Number 1 Brand of Can Openers in the U.S.
Removable, dishwasher-safe cutting unit: Can opener has a removable, dishwasher-safe cutting unit to make cleanup simple.
Surecut patented technology: Kitchen can opener has patented surecut technology—Opens cans the first time, every time.
Extra-tall design: Tall can opener's design (10.24" H X 5.12" W X 6.9" D) lets you easily open a variety of can sizes.
Auto shutoff: Can opener has auto shutoff, for easy, hands-free operation.
Source: The Npd group, Inc. 12 Months Ending December 2018.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,646 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
